Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for data storage, analytics workloads, scalability, and integration with existing systems. Identify the types of data and analytics processes that will be supported.
Design the data architecture, including folder structure, naming conventions, and access patterns. Plan for data ingestion, processing, and analytics workflows.
Create and configure the Azure Data Lake Storage account. Ensure the account is set up with the required performance tier and redundancy options.
Configure security settings, including encryption at rest and in transit, access control lists (ACLs), and role-based access control (RBAC). Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Configure data ingestion pipelines using Azure Data Factory or other tools. Ensure pipelines are optimized for performance and reliability.
Integrate analytics tools such as Azure Synapse Analytics, Databricks, or HDInsight with Azure Data Lake Storage for data processing and analysis.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Log Analytics. Configure alerts for storage capacity, data access patterns, and pipeline failures.
Perform testing of data ingestion, processing, and analytics workflows. Validate data accuracy, performance, and failover mechanisms.
Analyze storage and analytics performance metrics. Implement optimizations such as partitioning, caching, and query tuning.
Create detailed documentation for the data architecture, security configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Train the operations and analytics teams on using Azure Data Lake Storage and integrated tools. Provide guidance on troubleshooting and best practices.
Ensure the setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
